means: 宣布…已升入真福品位（beatify的过去式与过去分词形式）

sentence.Network_en: Mother Teresa was beatified in 2003 but not yet been canonized by the Vatican.
sentence.Network_cn: 德雷莎修女在2003年被行宣福礼.但至今还未被梵蒂冈评为圣徒.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ... . . .。死后他因他献身宗教，被册封为圣人，但这一进程要求后被罗马教皇格雷戈里十一世宣布无效。在1904年，他被宣福(beatified)。3子女妻子德勒的让娜(Joanna of Dreux)，五个孩子.

list.abs: 英语词根6 - Leo.Zhu - 博客园 ... barrier n 障碍 beatify v 祝福 beatific a 快乐的；天使般的.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(B) ... beatification 受福 beatify 享受 beating 打.
we should spare no effort to beatify our environment .我们应该不遗余力的美化我们的环境。

entry.def: When the Catholic church beatifies someone who is dead, it declares officially that they were a holy person, usually as the first step towards making them a saint.

example.ex: In May, Pope John Paul is to beatify Gianna Beretta.
example.tran: 5月，教皇约翰·保罗将为吉安娜·贝雷塔行宣福礼。

means.word_mean: 1. Roman Catholic; proclaimed one of the blessed and thus worthy of veneration

auth_sentence.content: When an ailing John Paul beatified Mother Teresa in 2003 in St.
auth_sentence.res_content: When an ailing John Paul beatified Mother Teresa in 2003 in St.
